group_1.narration: Any theme of art that excites me@always has the lively scent of life!@Whether I am drawing life, death, emotion...@All those subjects contain it somewhere.
And all these people selfishly@draw themselves into my work...
Why is that?
It must be the same as how that@idiota's beloved Magical Kirin is loved...
The core of its beauty attracts readers.@My own work speaks to those who@witness it in a similar manner.
And even I, Alina, was making art work in@accordance with that core message.

group_1.textCenter: Like Touka said, by hunting for outlets of@shared emotion...
You may come to conclude that everything @shares a collective unconsciousness.
This "death drive" is an urge that draws you@towards death.
...under the influence of that very urge.

group_1.narration: That explains everything.
I, Alina, and all these other people... We@were dreaming of death without knowing it.
That's why I make my art...@And why these people are entranced by it.
That is also the reason I was able@to complete my artwork perfectly.
Because people are all@silently pondering death.

group_1.textCenter: A conversation piece befitting Alina Gray.
By enlisting our participation, you had us@dirty our own space like this...
It forces you to make a direct parallel to@the same problem on a global scale.
That was her goal all along!

group_1.narration: That makes for a fine surface-level read.@But what I was hoping to determine was@whether humanity is blithely staring at@its own doom...or trying to destroy itself.
No matter how humans satiate their desires,@it's never enough. They yearn for even more.@They strangle themselves with greed.
And this time, by clamoring to take part in@my work, just as he said...they stained it.@Their reward was nothing but trash.
Humans unconsciously long to die...
And ever since they were put on this earth,@they've coveted their own destruction.
It started from attacking individuals.@Then it went to attacking groups.@But even that was not enough. They now@crave the destruction of the whole world.

group_1.textCenter: Is this theme of yours like animal husbandry?

group_1.narration: She really is an idiota...
Though perhaps I, Alina, am one also.@I didn't realize before now, after all.
But now I understand...
Eve is not a work of art.
It is, in fact, a paintbrush.
In order for I, Alina, to create my finest@work, I must use that paintbrush.
To create a utopia for humanity...

group_1.textRight: You just started cackling out of nowhere...

group_1.textLeft: I suppose it's because I've finally found@the core of my work.
I'm in such an incredible mood.

group_1.textRight: So what is it? Your core?

group_1.textLeft: To change the world...for the sake of all@mankind.

group_1.textRight: You sound like a cartoon supervillain.

group_1.narration: *Growl*
*Suck* *Slurp* *Slurp*

group_1.textRight: What's the matter, Alina? You called me out@here so suddenly.

group_1.textLeft: There was something I wanted to ask you to@do for me.
I, Alina, want you to make a [textBlue:Rumor] for me.
I want to help those who are suffering and@unable to fulfill their desires.

group_1.textRight: What are you planning to do with it?

group_1.textLeft: I'll let it wander around for a while so@it can harvest some power.
And then, I will dress myself in it just like@Mami did.
It's a necessary step I must take...
...in order to complete my ultimate work.

group_1.textRight: So instead of using the Uwasa, you are going@to become one with it.

group_1.textCenter: Ah ha ha! I, Alina, was right all along!@My vision is limitless!
